Package nzilbb.ag

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,​V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,​V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap<String,​Object>
          • nzilbb.ag.TrackedMap
            • nzilbb.ag.Layer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<String,​Object>, CloneableBean
    public class Layer
extends TrackedMap
    Annotation graph layer.

    Each annotation belongs to a Layer, which defines what layer its parent annotation is on, and how its anchors relate to its parent annotation's anchors.

    The primary defining characteristics of a layer are:

    • parentId - what layer parent annotations are on
    • alignment - whether this annotation is not aligned (i.e. simply tags the parent annotation), or defines a instant, or an interval.
    • peers - whether there is one child annotation per parent (e.g. orthography tags on word tokens), or children can have peers (e.g. word tokens in a turn, or different POS tags on a word token)
    • peersOverlap - if there are peers, whether they can overlap (e.g. topic tags within a graph, syntactic parse annotations within a turn) or not (e.g. word tokens within a turn, utterance partitions within a turn, turn annotations for a participant)
    • parentIncludes - whether the child annotation's anchors must have offsets between the parent's offsets (e.g. word tokens within a turn, tag annotations, syntactic parse annotations within a turn) or not (e.g. syntactic dependency annotations linking one word to another)
    • saturated - whether the child annotations fully cover the duration of the parent (e.g. utterance partitions within a turn, tag annotations) or not (e.g. word tokens within a turn, which may have leading, intervening, or trailing pauses)
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Layer

        public Layer()
        Default constructor

      • Layer

        public Layer​(String id,
             String description)
        Bare name constructor. This is provided for 'builder pattern' style contruction, like: Layer layer = new Layer("phone", "Phones") .setParentId("word") .setAlignment(Constants.ALIGNMENT_INTERVAL) .setPeers(true) .setPeersOverlap(false)
        Parameters:
        id - The layer's identifier.
        description - The description of the layer.

      • Layer

        public Layer​(String id)
        Bare name constructor where the name and description are the same. This is provided for 'builder pattern' style contruction, like: Layer layer = new Layer("phone") .setParentId("word") .setAlignment(Constants.ALIGNMENT_INTERVAL) .setPeers(true) .setPeersOverlap(false)
        Parameters:
        id - The layer's identifier.

      • Layer

        public Layer​(String id,
             String description,
             int alignment,
             boolean peers,
             boolean peersOverlap,
             boolean saturated,
             String parentId,
             boolean parentIncludes)
        Attribute constructor.
        Parameters:
        id - The layer's identifier.
        description - The description of the layer.
        parentId - The layer's parent layer id
        alignment - The layer's alignment - 0 for none, 1 for point alignment, 2 for interval alignment.
        peers - Whether children on this layer have peers or not.
        peersOverlap - Whether child peers can overlap or not.
        parentIncludes - Whether the parent t-includes the child.
        saturated - Whether children on this layer must temporally fill the entire parent duration (true) or not (false).

      • Layer

        public Layer​(String id,
             String description,
             int alignment,
             boolean peers,
             boolean peersOverlap,
             boolean saturated)
        Top-level layer constructor. The parentId is taken to be "transcript".
        Parameters:
        id - The layer's identifier.
        description - The description of the layer.
        alignment - The layer's alignment - 0 for none, 1 for point alignment, 2 for interval alignment.
        peers - Whether children on this layer have peers or not.
        peersOverlap - Whether child peers can overlap or not.
        saturated - Whether children on this layer must temporally fill the entire parent duration (true) or not (false).

        JSON constructor.

        All attributes are copied, including those that are not bean attributes; other are stored as map values.

        Parameters:
        json - JSON representation of the layer.

        @ClonedProperty
@TrackedProperty
public LinkedHashMap<String,​String> getValidLabels()
        Getter for validLabels: List of valid label values for this layer, or null if the layer values are not restricted.

        The 'key' is the possible label value, and each key is associated with a description of the value (e.g. for displaying to users).

        List of valid label values for this layer, or null if the layer values are not restricted.

      • getAncestors

        public LinkedHashSet<Layer> getAncestors()
        Returns a list of ancestor layers (parent, grandparent, etc.).
        Returns:
        A set of ancestor layers, ordered by distance from this annotation (i.e. parent first, then grandparent, etc.).

      • isAncestor

        public boolean isAncestor​(String layerId)
        Determines whether the given layer is an ancestor of this layer.
        Parameters:
        layerId -
        Returns:
        true if the given layer is an ancestor, and false otherwise.

      • getFirstCommonAncestor

        public Layer getFirstCommonAncestor​(Layer other)
        Determines the first ancestor layer this layer has in common with the given layer. This may return the graph layer itself, if there are no earlier common ancestors. "Ancestors" is inclusive in the sense that if either annotation is an ancestor of the other, it will be returned.
        Parameters:
        other - The other layer.
        Returns:
        The first ancestor layer this layer has in common with the given layer, or null if the hierarchy is incomplete and no common ancestor was found.

      • getDescendantDepth

        public int getDescendantDepth()
        Returns the maximum depth of the descendants of the layer.

        e.g.

        • if the layer has no children descendant depth = 0
        • if the layer has children, but no grandchildren (i.e. no child layers have children) descendant depth = 1
        • if the layer has children, and some have grandchildren, but there are no great-granchildren (i.e. no grandchild layers have children) descendant depth = 2
        Returns:
        The maximum descendant depth.

      • isDescendant

        public boolean isDescendant​(String layerId)
        Determines whether the given layer is a descendant of this layer.
        Parameters:
        layerId -
        Returns:
        true if the given layer is a descendant, and false otherwise.

      • getDescendants

        public Set<Layer> getDescendants()
        Gets all descendant layers.
        Returns:
        A (possibly empty) set of descendant layers.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Computes a hashCode for the object.

        Map (base class) has a very mutable hashCode, but we don't want Anchor hashcodes changing whenever arbitrary elements change (otherwise they get lost in hash-based collections, etc.). So this implementation returns the hashcode of the anchor's id.

        Specified by:
        hashCode in interface Map<String,​Object>
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class TrackedMap
        Returns:
        Object's hashCode.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Object obj)
        Indicates whether an object is "equal to" this one.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Map<String,​Object>
        Overrides:
        equals in class TrackedMap
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to compare to.
        Returns:
        true if obj is an Anchor with the same id as this one, false otherwise.
